text.p: The pound hit a 52-month high against the yen on Wednesday, boosted by aggressive buying by Japanese investors attracted to sterling's comparatively high-yield, traders said.

Sterling also gained on the mark against a backdrop of fresh European economic monetary union (EMU) jitters after news that a compromise plan that would allow Italy to join EMU after 1999 was being considered.
The break through the psychologically important 200 yen level invigorated the pound on all fronts. It rose over three pfennigs against the mark and was up over a cent against the dollar.
